AI Notebook Documentation

Author

Gerd Graßhoff

Published

January 15, 2025

1 Introduction

AI Notebook is a tool for processing notebooks with AI-enhanced blocks and audio files. It supports multiple AI providers and offers a flexible template system for structured prompts.

2 Installation

pip install ainotebook

3 Configuration

Required environment variables:

OPENAI_API_KEY=sk-...
GOOGLE_API_KEY=...
ANTHROPIC_API_KEY=sk-ant-...
GROQ_API_KEY=gsk_...

4 Basic Usage

4.1 Text Processing

Create a QMD file with AI blocks:

---
model: claude-haiku
template:
  file: analyze.j2
  variables:
    TEXT: document.txt
---
Your instruction here

4.2 Audio Processing

Process audio files using supported models:

aiaudio file.mp3 --model whisper
aiaudio file.mp3 --model gemini-pro

5 Template System

5.1 Basic Templates

Single template usage:

---
model: gemini-2
template:
  file: translate.j2
  variables:
    TEXT: transcript
    LANG: "German"
---
Additional instructions

5.2 Multiple Templates

Combine multiple templates:

---
model: claude-sonnet
template:
  - file: analyze.j2
    variables:
      TEXT: document.txt
      STYLE: "academic"
  - file: summarize.j2
    variables:
      LENGTH: "short"
---

6 Output Structure

Results are stored in organized directories:

  • process/: Generated responses
    • filename.json: Text processing results
    • filename_audio.json: Audio processing results
  • ai-views/: Generated visualizations
    • filename-vis.qmd: Visual analysis notebooks
1  AI-Ensemble
3  AI Notebook Structure
Source Code
# Introduction

AI Notebook is a tool for processing notebooks with AI-enhanced blocks and audio files. It supports multiple AI providers and offers a flexible template system for structured prompts.

# Installation

```bash
pip install ainotebook
```

# Configuration

Required environment variables:

```bash
OPENAI_API_KEY=sk-...
GOOGLE_API_KEY=...
ANTHROPIC_API_KEY=sk-ant-...
GROQ_API_KEY=gsk_...
```

# Basic Usage

## Text Processing

Create a QMD file with AI blocks:

```ai
---
model: claude-haiku
template:
  file: analyze.j2
  variables:
    TEXT: document.txt
---
Your instruction here
```

## Audio Processing

Process audio files using supported models:

```bash
aiaudio file.mp3 --model whisper
aiaudio file.mp3 --model gemini-pro
```

# Template System

## Basic Templates

Single template usage:

```ai
---
model: gemini-2
template:
  file: translate.j2
  variables:
    TEXT: transcript
    LANG: "German"
---
Additional instructions
```

## Multiple Templates

Combine multiple templates:

```ai
---
model: claude-sonnet
template:
  - file: analyze.j2
    variables:
      TEXT: document.txt
      STYLE: "academic"
  - file: summarize.j2
    variables:
      LENGTH: "short"
---
```

# Output Structure

Results are stored in organized directories:

- `process/`: Generated responses
  - `filename.json`: Text processing results
  - `filename_audio.json`: Audio processing results
- `ai-views/`: Generated visualizations
  - `filename-vis.qmd`: Visual analysis notebooks
